definitions.definition: to make a formal request, usually in writing, for something such as a job, a loan, permission for something, a place at a university, etc.
definitions.sensetop: apply for somethingapply to somebody/somethingapply to somebody/something for somethingapply to do something

examples.text: You should apply in person/by letter.
I have decided to **apply for** this new **job**.
They have successfully applied for political asylum.
to **apply for a visa/passport/grant/licence**
The developers **applied for** planning **permission** to build over 200 houses.
to apply to a company/university
They may apply to the court for the decision to be reversed.
He has applied to join the army.
You can apply by letter or on-line.
I decided to apply to Manchester University.
We're worried that the new fees might discourage some students from applying.

definitions.definition: to affect or be relevant to somebody/something
definitions.sensetop: apply to somebody/somethingapply something to somebody/something

examples.text: Special conditions apply if you are under 18.
The **rules applied** to employees and their behaviour at work.
What I am saying applies only to some of you.
The policy will **apply equally** to everyone.
The **law applied** only to workers in member states.
The word ‘unexciting’ could never be applied to her novels.
These principles apply equally in all cases.
These restrictions do not apply to us.
British companies are subject to international laws and the same applies to companies in Europe.

definitions.definition: to use something or make something work in a particular situation

examples.text: to **apply** political **pressure**
The challenge allows students to **apply** economic **principles** they learn in class.
to apply economic sanctions
to apply a test/method/technique/approach/rule
We need to **apply** the same **standards** to ourselves as to others.
The new technology was applied to farming.
Now is the time to apply the insights you have gained from your studies.

definitions.definition: to put or spread something such as paint, cream, etc. onto a surface

examples.text: Apply the cream sparingly to your face and neck.
The glue should be applied to both surfaces.
She combed her hair and carefully applied her make-up.
The paint was applied with a fine brush.
I carefully applied a creamy foundation.
Never apply the cleaning liquid directly to the surface.

definitions.definition: to work at something or study something very hard

examples.text: You would pass your exams if you applied yourself.
We applied our minds to finding a solution to our problem.

definitions.definition: to press on something hard with your hand, foot, etc. to make something work or have an effect on something

examples.text: to apply the brakes (of a vehicle)
Pressure applied to the wound will stop the bleeding.

wordOrigin: late Middle English: from Old French aplier, from Latin applicare ‘fold, fasten to’, from ad- ‘to’ + plicare ‘to fold’.
